string.text: Weapon monitoring system

This closely integrated onboard computer runs specialized software which continuously monitors the status of critical components and displays diagnostic results on the screen. It provides a range of options for adjusting to the shooter's preference. \n \n%c[01,255,128,0](Tip: use the firing mode key to toggle the computer functions on or off).
Snipe-Guard complex

A suite of infrared sensors, integrated directly with the trigger assembly, passively detect targets on the battlefield and prevent a suspected miss by blocking the trigger if pulled. The system is designed to only work with living targets. \n \n%c[01,255,128,0](Tip: use the firing mode key to toggle the computer functions on or off).
Safari-Snipe complex

This system was developed with experienced military snipers in mind, for whom a missed shot can make all the difference. When activated, the trigger can be held indefinitely in a pre-fire stage and automatically fire when the shooter's aim passes over a living target. This logic is meant to counteract any potential failures from the auto-targeting system if certain camouflage patterns confuse its programming. The weapon will always fire on trigger release, regardless of where it's currently aimed. \n \n%c[01,255,128,0](Tip: use the firing mode key to toggle the computer functions on or off).
Ideal-M complex

Extremely effective continuous shooter assistance system. Complicated in design, easy to use, and extremely fast to operate. Just squeeze the trigger and aim at the target. The rifle will take care of the rest. Initially designed for detecting living targets but will often detect lifeless ones as well. The system proved to significantly reduce the number of misses even by novice shooters. \n \n%c[01,255,128,0](Tip: use the firing mode key to toggle the computer functions on or off).
Replace the wiring
Replace the original aluminum wiring with more efficient, high-quality copper alternatives, resulting in higher projectile velocities.
Low-impedance overdrive coils
Reduces the heat generated by the firing sequence, which leads to a longer service life and higher projectile velocities.
Magnetic recoil compensator

By utilizing certain phenomena of electromagnetic induction, the compensator generates a counter-force against the weapon's natural recoil, making follow-up shots easier and the weapon itself more comfortable to fire.
Fast-charge capacitors
These capacitors charge up to levels sufficient for firing much faster than the originals, allowing for a faster rate of fire.
Upgrade to supercapacitors

Replacing the standard capacitors with supercapacitors extends the life and reliability of the weapon, as well as improving projectile velocity. Unfortunately, the higher power requirements reduces the number of shots that can be harvested from a single battery before needing to be replaced.
Low ESR capacitors
Capacitors with lower resistance and reduced leakage across insulating frameworks. Prolongs battery life and allows for more shots to be taken before needing to be replaced.
Optical magnifier unit
Installation of an optical magnifier allows for a wide range of adjustable zoom levels.
Photomultiplier unit
Installing a photomultiplier unit allows to you adjust the optical contrast, which makes firing in low-light conditions much easier.
Power supply modification
Improves the weapon's reliability and allows for the use of non-factory batteries.
Lightweight stock
Replacing the stock with a lightweight alternative reduces the overall weight of the weapon.
Improved buttstock
Installation of an anatomical rubberized buttstock reduces the recoil felt by the shooter.
Forend replacement
An improved forend makes the gun easier to handle and more comfortable to hold.
Protective coating
The application of a special coating to the electrical components can significantly reduce the buildup of corrosion.
Digital sight control unit
Controls the lens focus and image processing more efficiently, which brings targets into resolution much faster when changing magnification levels.
Electromagnetic shielding
Adding electromagnetic shielding around the power supply of the weapon decreases negative EMF interference on the internal firing modules, reducing the potential for misfires significantly.
Target acquisition system

Integration of the latest automatic target detection, locking, and tracking system into the weapon's sighing module, capable of detecting even the most heavily camouflaged adversaries in all weapon conditions. When a positive identification occurs, a frame is overlayed around the point of interest, informing the shooter about its presence. This can occur even if the target isn't currently in the field of view. Additional functionality includes an onboard IFF "friend-or-foe" target recognition complex.
